abstract: The 37 percent decline in Bank of America’s earnings reflects the persistent burden of Countrywide Financial, the subprime mortgage lender it bought in 2008.
snippet: The 37 percent decline in Bank of America’s earnings reflects the persistent burden of Countrywide Financial, the subprime mortgage lender it bought in 2008.
lead_paragraph: As big banks slowly shake off losses from the financial crisis, Bank of America provided another reminder on Friday of how hard it is to shed the legacy of the past.

headline.main: Mortgage Woes Stall Bank of America Revival

abstract: Why are there so few good stories about working men and women? A collection edited by Richard Ford, “Blue Collar, White Collar, No Collar,” fills the void.
snippet: Why are there so few good stories about working men and women? A collection edited by Richard Ford, “Blue Collar, White Collar, No Collar,” fills the void.
lead_paragraph: I’VE often wondered why there aren’t more strong works of fiction dealing with the business world. Offhand, with the possible exception of Tom Wolfe’s “The Bonfire of the Vanities,” Richard Ford’s real estate dramas, or Michael Crichton’s forgettable “Disclosure,” I can’t think of many novels of recent years that grapple with the kinds of issues most business people encounter.

headline.main: Workplace Fiction That’s True to Life
headline.print_headline: Workplace Fiction That’s True to Life
